TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1922: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1928), 3 vols., Vol 2, pp. 966
TEI.2.document_title: Stephen F Austin to Samuel M Williams, 05-09-1833

barker_notes.barker_summary: Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Bexar, May 9, 1833. Inhabitants agree substantially with sentiments of convention, but will not support the petition. Gin for Seguin.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 966

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*Austin to Samuel M. Williams, Bexar, May 9, 1833. Inhabitants agree substantially with sentiments of convention, but will not support the petition. Gin for Seguin.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p*[From Williams Papers, Rosenberg Library, Galveston, Tex.]*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="05-09-1833">May 9 1833*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir,*/p*
*p*The *person_mentioned*legislature */person_mentioned*adjourned on the *date_mentioned n="04-30-1833">last of april*/date_mentioned* and *person_mentioned*Madero */person_mentioned*will soon be on (as he says in a letter to a person in this place). I wrote to him from here and informed [him] that you would be at home the *date_mentioned n="05-31-1833">last of this month*/date_mentioned*, by which time I think he will be on.*/p*
*p*I owe something to *person_mentioned*Don Erasmo [Seguin]*/person_mentioned*—he refused to receive pay for the time my *person_mentioned*brother */person_mentioned*staid here, and I have always staid here in my visits to *location_mentioned*Bexar */location_mentioned*and he never would receive pay—he has planted cotton and wants a *location_mentioned*gin*/location_mentioned*. I wish you to make arrangements to get one for him on my account—not of the largest size, a strong *location_mentioned*gin*/location_mentioned* of the common kind would suit him better than any other for it would be easier kept in order. I wish you to write to him on the subject.*/p*
*p*The people here agree in substance with the rest of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*but differ as to the manner, and will express no opinion for, nor against.*/p*
*p*I leave *date_mentioned n="05-08-1833">tomorrow */date_mentioned*for *location_mentioned*Goliad */location_mentioned*and *location_mentioned*Matamoros*/location_mentioned*, the whole *location_mentioned*country*/location_mentioned* here is inundated by excessive floods of rain. The *location_mentioned*indians */location_mentioned*have killed two *location_mentioned*men */location_mentioned*within the last two days—one *location_mentioned*within three leagues up Salado*/location_mentioned* the other at *location_mentioned*Arroyo Hondo beyond Medina*/location_mentioned*.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*S. M. Williams*/person_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
